article.headline: Davidson 67, Wofford 58
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. -- Brendan McKillop hit five 3-pointers and scored 16 points to lead Davidson to a 67-58 victory over Wofford on Wednesday night, extending the Wildcats' winning streak to five games. Davidson (13-12, 7-7 Southern conference) led 37-27 at halftime, but the Terriers opened the second half on a 16-2 run, capped by Kevin Giltner's three-point play, to lead 43-39. The Wildcats did not score their first second-half points until De'Mon Brooks' layup with 13:52 left. After a 3-pointer by Jake Cohen and two by McKillop pushed the Wildcats ahead 48-45, Wofford (13-12, 10-4) took its last lead at 50-48 on a Cameron Rundles 3 with 8:16 to go. JP Kuhlman scored five straight points, starting with a three-point play, to push Davidson ahead for good. Rundles and Jamar Diggs scored 13 points apiece for Wofford (13-12, 10-4), which came in having won three of its previous four.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
